semantic_title: Guidelines for Leukemia, Multiple Myeloma, and Malignant Plasma Cell Neoplasms in Remission versus Personal History
section_path: Section I > C. Chapter-Specific Coding Guidelines > 2. Chapter 2: Neoplasms > n. Leukemia, Multiple Myeloma, and Malignant Plasma Cell Neoplasms in remission versus personal history

content.full_text: The categories for leukemia, and category C90, Multiple myeloma and malignant plasma cell neoplasms, have codes indicating whether or not the leukemia has achieved remission. There are also codes Z85.6, Personal history of leukemia, and Z85.79, Personal history of other malignant neoplasms of lymphoid, hematopoietic and related tissues. If the documentation is unclear as to whether the leukemia has achieved remission, the provider should be queried. (Evidence: pg no: 38, L58-L62)
content.summary: Guidelines for coding leukemia and related neoplasms in remission versus using personal history codes (Evidence: pg no: 38, L58-L62)
key_concepts: Leukemia categories have remission indicators (Evidence: pg no: 38, L58-L60)
C90 category includes remission codes (Evidence: pg no: 38, L60)
Personal history codes Z85.6 and Z85.79 available (Evidence: pg no: 38, L60-L62)
Query provider if remission status unclear (Evidence: pg no: 38, L62)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Leukemia categories and C90 have codes indicating whether leukemia has achieved remission (Evidence: pg no: 38, L58-L60)
detailed_rules.explanation: These specific neoplasm categories include built-in remission status indicators within the code structure (Evidence: pg no: 38, L58-L60)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Personal history codes Z85.6 and Z85.79 are available for leukemia and related tissues (Evidence: pg no: 38, L60-L62)
detailed_rules.explanation: Alternative personal history codes exist for these hematopoietic malignancies when appropriate (Evidence: pg no: 38, L60-L62)

detailed_rules.rule_text: If documentation is unclear as to whether leukemia has achieved remission, the provider should be queried (Evidence: pg no: 38, L62)
detailed_rules.explanation: Accurate remission status is critical for proper code selection and requires clarification when documentation is ambiguous (Evidence: pg no: 38, L62)

workflow_steps: Step 1: Identify leukemia, multiple myeloma, or malignant plasma cell neoplasm
Step 2: Review documentation for remission status
Step 3a: If remission status clear - use appropriate remission code
Step 3b: If remission status unclear - query provider
Step 4: Consider personal history codes when appropriate

incorrect_coding.rationale: Should use remission code when remission status is documented

Step 3: Query provider for clarification of current disease status

codes: C90.00 (Multiple myeloma not having achieved remission)
incorrect_coding.rationale: Should not assume remission status without clear documentation
incorrect_coding.common_mistake: Coding without clarifying unclear remission status

warnings: Always query provider when remission status is unclear (Evidence: pg no: 38, L62)
best_practices: Use built-in remission indicators when available (Evidence: pg no: 38, L58-L60)
Consider personal history codes when appropriate (Evidence: pg no: 38, L60-L62)

tips: Leukemia and multiple myeloma have specific remission indicators (Evidence: pg no: 38, L58-L60)
Personal history codes are available as alternatives (Evidence: pg no: 38, L60-L62)
